[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Crime & Criminal Tracking Network and Systems (CCTNS) improves crime tracking, citizen interaction, and police workflows.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CCTNS integrates with court systems and citizen portals via RESTful APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CCTNS provides web-based responsive interfaces for police personnel and citizens.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CCTNS operates on secure cloud servers and police workstations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CCTNS supports PostgreSQL 16 and OpenAPI-based APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CCTNS is optimized for minimal endpoint memory usage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CCTNS ensures 24/7 availability with automated failover.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CCTNS operates across diverse network setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CCTNS integrates with Aadhaar for identity verification.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 MISSING-TAG2: CCTNS uses HTTPS and TLS 1.3 for secure communications.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CCTNS provides complaint registration, investigation tracking, and citizen support.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include citizens, police personnel, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CCTNS requires stable internet and API access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CCTNS relies on operational external services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Complaint: Request by a citizen for police intervention.
Evidence: Material relevant to a criminal investigation.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: CCTNS: Crime & Criminal Tracking Network and Systems
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 MISSING-TAG1: CCTNS facilitates complaint handling, evidence management, and secure communication among stakeholders.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with court systems to manage case statuses.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide secure complaint registration through citizen portals.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow citizens to file complaints and track updates (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable police to manage investigations, including evidence tracking (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive dashboards for user-friendly navigation.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support both desktop and mobile platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process case searches within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 2,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store complaints and logs in PostgreSQL 16.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support role-based access control.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall be compatible with Ubuntu 22.04 LTS.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide audit logging for administrative actions.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall scale dynamically based on demand.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to GDPR data protection regulations.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall ensure metadata compliance with open standards.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional validation, usability testing, and compliance assessments for GDPR and WCAG 2.1 will be performed.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Administrator guides, OpenAPI documentation, and technical support materials will be available.
[SEC] 5. References: WCAG 2.1, GDPR, OpenAPI, and TLS 1.3 specifications.
